plants.description: Achillea millefolium is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae, native to the Northern Hemisphere. It has been used in traditional medicine for centuries.
plants.uses: Achillea millefolium has been used to treat a variety of conditions, including fever, colds, and inflammation. It may also have antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties.
plants.habitat: Achillea millefolium can be found in a variety of habitats, including meadows, fields, and roadsides.

plants.description: Arctium lappa is a biennial plant in the family Asteraceae, native to Europe and Asia. It has large, heart-shaped leaves and purple flowers.
plants.uses: Arctium lappa has been used in traditional medicine to treat a variety of conditions, including skin problems, arthritis, and digestive issues. It may also have antibacterial and anti-inflammatory properties.
plants.habitat: Arctium lappa can be found in a variety of habitats, including fields, meadows, and waste areas.

plants.description: Artemisia absinthium is a herbaceous perennial plant in the family Asteraceae, native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It has silver-gray leaves and yellow flowers.
plants.uses: Artemisia absinthium has been used in traditional medicine to treat a variety of conditions, including digestive issues, fever, and menstrual problems. It is also used to make absinthe, a potent alcoholic beverage.
plants.habitat: Artemisia absinthium can be found in a variety of habitats, including roadsides, waste areas, and rocky slopes.

plants.description: Cannabis sativa is a dioecious plant in the family Cannabaceae, native to Central Asia. It has been used for thousands of years for its medicinal and psychoactive properties.
plants.uses: Cannabis sativa is used for a variety of medicinal and recreational purposes. It may be used to treat pain, nausea, and anxiety, and it is also used recreationally for its psychoactive effects.
plants.habitat: Cannabis sativa is commonly grown in temperate regions around the world, and it can also be found growing wild in some areas.

plants.description: Chamaenerion angustifolium is a herbaceous perennial plant in the family Onagraceae, native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It has pink to purple flowers and grows in open areas.
plants.uses: Chamaenerion angustifolium has been used in traditional medicine to treat a variety of conditions, including digestive issues and respiratory problems. It may also have anti-inflammatory properties.
plants.habitat: Chamaenerion angustifolium can be found in a variety of habitats, including meadows, fields, and forests.

plants.description: Filipendula ulmaria is a herbaceous perennial plant in the family Rosaceae, native to Europe and Asia. It has fragrant white or pink flowers and grows in wet habitats.
plants.uses: Filipendula ulmaria has been used in traditional medicine to treat a variety of conditions, including pain and fever. It may also have anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
plants.habitat: Filipendula ulmaria can be found in wet meadows, marshes, and along streams and ditches.

plants.description: St John's wort is a flowering plant with yellow flowers that grows in many parts of the world. It has a long history of use as a medicinal herb, particularly for treating mild to moderate depression and anxiety.
plants.uses: St John's wort is commonly used to treat mild to moderate depression, anxiety, and sleep disorders. It is also used for other conditions, such as nerve pain, PMS, and menopausal symptoms.
plants.habitat: St John's wort can be found in many different habitats, including fields, meadows, and woodland edges. It prefers sunny locations and well-drained soil.

plants.description: Hyoscyamus niger is a poisonous plant in the Solanaceae family, native to Europe, western Asia and northern Africa. It is an annual or biennial herbaceous plant that grows up to 1 metre tall.
plants.uses: Hyoscyamus niger has been used for its psychoactive and pain-relieving properties, but it is highly toxic and can cause hallucinations, delirium, and even death. It has also been used as a traditional medicine for various conditions, including asthma, coughs, and motion sickness.
plants.habitat: Hyoscyamus niger grows in disturbed habitats, such as waste places and roadsides.

plants.description: Hyssop is a perennial herb with blue or purple flowers. It is native to the Mediterranean region, but is now grown in many parts of the world as a medicinal and culinary herb.
plants.uses: Hyssop is used for a variety of conditions, including digestive problems, respiratory infections, and as a general tonic. It has also been used to help relieve anxiety and nervous tension.
plants.habitat: Hyssop is typically found in rocky, arid areas in the Mediterranean region, but is now grown in many parts of the world as a garden herb.

plants.description: Humulus lupulus is a species of flowering plant in the Cannabaceae family, native to Europe, western Asia and North America. It is a dioecious, perennial, herbaceous climbing plant that grows up to 6 metres tall.
plants.uses: The female flowers of Humulus lupulus are used in brewing to impart flavor and bitterness to beer. Hops have also been used for medicinal purposes, including as a sedative and a digestive aid.
plants.habitat: Humulus lupulus grows in a variety of soils and climates, but prefers moist, well-drained soils and full sun.

plants.description: Mandragora officinarum is a poisonous plant in the Solanaceae family, native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that grows up to 0.3 metres tall.
plants.uses: Mandragora officinarum has been used for its psychoactive properties and as a traditional medicine for various conditions, including pain relief, sleep disorders, and as an anesthetic.
plants.habitat: Mandragora officinarum grows in rocky and arid habitats.

plants.description: Heal-all is a common herb that is found in many parts of the world. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used for centuries to treat a variety of ailments.
plants.uses: Heal-all has been used to treat a wide range of conditions, including sore throat, wounds, and respiratory infections. It is also believed to have anti-inflammatory and antiviral properties.
plants.habitat: Heal-all is a common plant that grows in meadows, fields, and along roadsides.

plants.description: Dandelion is a common weed that is found in many parts of the world. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used for centuries to treat a variety of ailments.
plants.uses: Dandelion has been used to treat a wide range of conditions, including liver and digestive disorders, skin problems, and arthritis. It is also believed to have diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
plants.habitat: Dandelion is a common plant that grows in meadows, fields, and along roadsides.

plants.description: Thymus serpyllum, commonly known as wild thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and Asia.
plants.uses: Traditionally used to treat respiratory infections and as a natural insect repellent.
plants.habitat: Prefers dry, rocky soils and full sun.

plants.description: A common perennial herbaceous plant with stinging hairs. It is found in many parts of the world.
plants.uses: Nettle leaves and roots have been used for traditional medicine, food, and textiles.
plants.habitat: Nettle prefers moist soils and is often found in disturbed areas, especially near human habitation.

plants.description: A biennial herbaceous plant with fuzzy leaves and a tall spike of yellow flowers.
plants.uses: Mullein has been used in traditional medicine for a variety of ailments, including respiratory disorders and skin conditions.
plants.habitat: Mullein is often found in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides, fields, and meadows.
